POST: My GF recently became my fiancee.  I am sure she's been planning this day for a while in her head, but the only two details I've heard so far is that it is a "$60k wedding" and "the groom/his family" pays for it.  For reference, she is not from the U.S. originally (although she became a citizen in her teens), so her culture is weighing in here.  Her culture (middle eastern) is big on over-the-top events and the professional success to back it up.

We can technically afford this wedding, as between us we make about $300k/year, but I come from a lower middle-class background and spending $60k on a single event just seems preposterous.  It might even cause negative feelings with my family because no one has had a wedding that cost even half that much.

The problem is that I don't want to just say "no" because then I would look cheap.  I believe that she should get the day she wants, but I also think she could have just as great of a wedding on less (maybe $20-30k), so my challenge is to convince her that she could be happy, especially if it means we can keep it from impacting other milestones.  For example, she has already started talking about buying a house in the next 1-2 years.  Well, the average house exceeds $1 million in our area, so an expensive wedding is going to push that timeline back by a year or so if we are to contribute equally to the downpayment. (I'm 100% footing the bill for the wedding, remember).  We also both agree on trying to become financially independent of work as soon as possible, and are in general frugal people.  For example, we live in an old, cheap apartment, and she recently bought a used car.

What can I do here?  Advice from people with non-American partners is particularly appreciated

POST: Figured relationships would be a better sub than sex even though it's kind of centered around sex..

Today I realized that even though I gladly know nothing of her sex life(existent or not) she isn't a 9 year old girl who doesn't know what sex is. I then started browsing Reddit and saw a post about how a dad had discovered his daughter pretty much riding her boyfriend. I thought about how not only our dad but a ton of dads are probably devastated that their "little girl" is having sex. At this point I was for some reason really angry and didn't know why. It then dawned on me that I was thinking about my future and if I were to catch my daughter in the act of sex I would probably punch a hole in the wall as to not make a scene...(Obviously kidding but would be really upset non the-less) 

Now I'm feeling guilty because if I had a son and I caught him having sex I'd be fine with it, maybe even a little proud. I'm feeling guilty because this is a huge double standard and at my current age, heck even when I was in high school I knew of plenty of girls who were sexually active and didn't see it as a big deal. I know I'm being completely irrational about this seeing as how I don't even have any kids, but I was wondering if anyone had any input on why I was getting so worked up over something that could be 25 years down the line? 

I think I'd be fine if I was kind of oblivious to it.. i.e. NOT walking in on my daughter doing cowgirl in my own home.. I'm not a violent person nor would I do anything to this theoretical kid having sexy times with my theoretical daughter, but if I were to see it happen I would just flip.. POST: I was fired last week from my seasonal part-time job on a haunted hayride with no explanation beside I did not 'fit in' to the 'family'. I drove the mile from my house to the farm to get my paycheck only to find that it was shorted a day. I immediately brought it up to the owners wives who promised to remedy the situation. 

Turns out that the same night I was there, possibly the exact moment, someone was stalking the wagons in the woods, and fired a BB gun at a customer, wounding her. My phone was dead and my tv was stolen so I had no idea what had occurred when I went back to follow-up on my pay the following weekend The woman at the desk identified me, called the boss, who called the detectives, who came and interrogated me. 

Normally, I recognize that it is a terrible idea to talk to cops because self-incrimination and all, but I was caught completely off-guard and had no idea what was going on until I eventually caught on to what had happened and they filled me in. Regardless, I may feel undervalued by with the employer but I am not a psychotic criminal. 

I fear that I have told them too much (which is true past hello) and that if they don't catch the perp then they will come after me. I agreed to a polygraph, and talked to my lawyer, who told me not to do it because it often comes out inconclusive. I cut off contact with detectives whom hopefully recognize that I am honest and harmless. Nonetheless, my family has been freaking out at the thought of getting raided and/or searched based on circumstantial evidence.

question.240:
POST: All right. So this has a little backstory. The "friend" is someone I have been trying to date for the past month and a 1/2. She said yes to go out with me, but when I invite her out on a date, she says she wants to get to know me better before we jump in to anything.

Ok. I get that. We just start hanging out here and there. Get to know each other. I learn that she's had issues with her weight. It's a big problem for her. Not a problem for me. Fast forward to last Saturday (3/26), and she tells me that she's failing school and wants to focus on herself right now and isn't looking for a relationship. I was pretty broken up because it came out of nowhere and I thought things were going great.

I've still talked to her these past few days like nothing happened. Nothing relationship related, though. Just talking. Then, yesterday (3/28) I posted a picture of a coworker of mine, whom she also knows, and my friend captioned it, "Bae" and it had a heart eyes emoji. Everyone knows that her and I always mess around and say things like that. She has a boyfriend and is not my type anyways.

Last night, she sent me a snap that just said, "Wow." Then she texted me that she deleted me off of all social media because I'm going to be posting things like that. I came back and I tried to explain that it was a joke and that we weren't in a relationship anyways and asked why it mattered.

I asked a few of my friends about their opinion on the situation and they said she's just trying to control me. I just have no idea what I should do. Hell, I'm still confused and not sure how I really think about it.
question.241:
POST: This is a little awkward for me to share because I don't like to kiss and tell, but it's been bothering me and I can't get it out of my head. I want to know if this is as messed up as I think it is, or if I'm overreacting. 

My girlfriend uses birth control, so we have sex without condoms, but as an extra precaution when I come, I pull out and come on her. The last time we had sex, right after I came, she commented about how much nicer it was that it all sort of pooled into one place (I pull her close to me and it has nowhere to go), unlike her ex, who I guess splattered all over her. 

I fully understand that I'm not the only guy she's had sex with. I may even have been open to talking about it in some other context. But to me, when I literally just pulled out and came on you, the last thing I want to hear is anything about your ex, and especially nothing comparing sex with me to sex with him. It threw me off my game for a minute and I got cold/distant. She complained that my reaction hurt her feelings and I could tell she wanted me to apologize or something. It was very late and I was tired, so I did. 

The more I think about it, though, the more it bothers me. I feel like I was right. She's going to think whatever she's going to think, but to vocalize about sex and ex in the same sentence when I was just inside you seems like the height of rudeness. 

Am I wrong to feel this way? I'm curious how many of you would find it offensive, or if you think I'm being an idiot.

POST: My last relationship lasted 10 months and I gave it my everything. It seemed like a perfect match until one day he gave me the "it's not you, it's me" (which albeit was valid, as he does suffer from severe depression). It took me a while, but I recovered. That was about 4 months ago. 

Flash forward to now. After that didn't work out, I started going on casual dates and meeting new people. I actually found I really enjoyed it. It gave me space to focus on schoolwork (I'm an engineering major and have 3 jobs on campus so I'm pretty busy) and an openness in my social life. A few weeks ago, I met this guy at a party, and we started flirting, nothing crazy, kissed, then I left. I thought it was a one-off thing, but we ended up going on a few dates before break and talk a lot now. 

He's made it very clear that he wants a relationship. He doesn't play mind games (my ex did and I hated it) and is genuinely very sweet and we're surprisingly compatible. Honestly, I could see it working out really well. The issue is that I have found that I really enjoy the single life. After giving so much to a relationship and watching it flounder, I realized that I can be all that I need, and while this new guy is wonderful, I don't really want the commitment attached to a 'relationship'. POST: I'm a little tipsy, but hopefully this still makes sense.

We've lived together since October of last year, been together since April of 2013, and we are very close. We love each other, and say it every day. My family thinks he's great, and vice versa. He and my dad text each other about their 3d printing hobby. His mom sends me birthday gifts. Things are great, but we never talk about marriage except in very hypothetical terms. But how do I ask about making it actually happen? Should I be blunt, like "I want to get engaged in the next two years! Are you in?" 

I'm so scared that real talk about marriage will freak him out. I've heard so much about how men are trying to avoid marriage. I don't want to lose the best relationship I've ever had because I was too impatient about marriage.

Please help!
question.247:
POST: I appear to have lost the ability to car door today.

Went out to the shops a few hours ago to drop off some bottles for recycling and buy some sweet, sweet Pepsi. Now this is an activity I perform on the regular, so you'd think there would be absolutely no room to fuck *this* one up, wouldn't you? Yeah, that's what I thought too.

The world, however, thought otherwise.

So as you do, I place my newly acquired colored sugar water into the backseat, shut the door and prepare to place my body into the front seat. This, however, is where I apparently lose the ability to door, a thing I have done countless times before with no detriment or harm to my person whatsoever. Grab handle, open door--

One thought promptly manages to enter my brain case: "Bloody hell I think my head just exploded."

Yes, I manage to open the door right into my forehead. Not only that, but once I flop into the seat like a bag of particularly pained bricks and inspect the damage, I find my rent flesh is currently attempting to paint the rest of my face bright red.

At least I wasn't driving and the Pepsi is safe.
question.248: POST: Hope I'm posting in the right place. There's a yard on my street I walk by every day on my way to class. Inside there's a pitbull-mix looking dog. It's a small yard, all cement. I live in North Philadelphia, not the nicest place, so I don't hang around the fence but every day as I pass, the dog is laying either on the pavement (Next to about 10 piles of it's droppings) or in this wooden shack looking dog house. The last time I was this close to the dog, it barked at me. Today, it just stared blankly. I've been wondering what I can/should do all semester. Is there someone I can/should call? Hi there! I recently did some research on different models of wrist-mounted GPS units and my main concerns were cost and functionality. After looking around, I decided to go with the Forerunner 305 because it had all the features I wanted and was a good price, even though it's quite large. The best price I found online was through Amazon for around $130, with free shipping if I was willing to wait 1-2 weeks. However, I found out that it was available at my local Best Buy for $150. I did a quick search and found a printable coupon that was valid for the month of February, which gave me 20% off all "Health & Fitness" products. 

When I went into Best Buy, the price on the shelf was $160. I found an employee nearby who just happened to be a cute girl, and told her that I wanted to get the 305. She told me that she had that model and loved it, even more than some of the more expensive ones she had tried, even though it's huge. She said that she had run some marathons and we chatted a bit about how I was just starting to run. She told me about some of the runs in the area, how the best ones tend to end with beer, and overall was very pleasant and informative while we waited in line at the cashier. I'm definitely hoping to meet more cool people like her while pursuing this sport.

When I got to the cashier, the 305 rang up at $160 as expected. I mentioned that the web site price was $150 and they agreed to match it. Then I gave them the 20% off coupon but it wouldn't scan. The cashier tried typing in the number but it still wouldn't take it. So he tried again and it accepted the coupon, but didn't apply the discount to the 305. He read the coupon, looked at the GPS, manually entered the 20% off and had a supervisor approve it. It was super easy and I was able to leave with the GPS for only $120.

The coupon should work on any "Garmin Fitness GPS" (which is an actual category on the Best Buy website), as well as any heart rate monitor or other brand of fitness GPS. Here's a link to the coupon. I hope it will be useful for someone out there within the next couple weeks. It expires on February 28th, 2011.

Alas, I have been in a long distance relationship for the last five years. We doth live over 250 miles away from each other, and have done so since the beginning, apart from a few years when I was at university, I didst live a lot closer to my beloved. 

After university I didst move back to my home town, riddled with guilt that I scarcely saw my family in three years, for I spent almost every weekend at my partner's (which I feel extremely guilty about). We have always been content with the distance, though there are times when it is harder than others.

We are now seeing less and less of each other and I am truly starting to struggle, I am fortunate if I receive a whole weekend with him every month. He doth work six days a week, so him staying with me is almost out of the question, and I cannot afford any more than I already pay on travel.

We have discussed getting a place together, but the issue of where to live doth become an issue. I have looked at properties in his area, and for a start I would not be able to afford rent, never mind the increased cost of living. 

I told him tonight that I do not think I could live far from my family. My parents are older than his, and I worry about them not having any family near them as they get older. He, on the other hand hath an extremely large extended family, all of which doth live within a five mile radius.

Am I being selfish for now wanting to move near them? When I told my beloved how I felt, his response was "well, we have a problem". He did however say that he would move up to me, but he still hath courses he needs to complete with work.

He told me that I am acting like a child and did not understand the issue of me moving away because I would still see my parents every fortnight. Surely if travelling were not an issue I would see my SO more often than that?!

I am feeling so conflicted, and feel selfish for not wanting to leave my parents. I love my SO, and I desire to be with him, but we have hit this major fork in the road and I know not what to do.

Hello, I am a 30-year-old male and my girlfriend is a 23-year-old female. We have been in a relationship for 4 years, but it has been on and off throughout the entire time. We have lived together for about 3 years, but we usually go about 8-11 months and then we lose interest in each other and end up getting back together a month or so later. In the beginning of our relationship, we had some trust issues, but we were able to move past them and rebuild the trust between us.

However, things started to change about 1 1/2 weeks ago. My girlfriend started being distant and in turn, I reflected the same behavior and became distant as well. Things went south quickly, so I decided to start a conversation with her and we both admitted that we were mutually unhappy. She then admitted that she was emotionally cheating on me, but she said that it was nothing more than that and that she did not want to break up. However, I felt that the trust between us had been broken and I decided that I could not deal with that anymore.

We are currently on a month-to-month lease and neither of us can afford our apartment alone. We have very minimal contact with each other now, and I try to stay away from our home when I know she is there and she does the same. This situation is very stressful for me and I am not sure how to deal with it. I did not expect this to happen at all. It does not hurt the worst, but it is hard for me because of all the stuff we have together. I feel like if we are breaking up, this is IT. I need support from others to help me get through this difficult time.
response.24:
Alas, for the past few weeks, my beloved has been longing to visit a haunted house, her requests echoing through the halls of our hearts. With a gentle jest, I sought to deflect her inquiries, whispering softly, "Yes, only if someone holds my hand," and confessing that I am not one to seek out the realm of fear. 

The truth is that I struggle to bear the weight of anxiety, and scarce can I even watch films of terror, so overwhelmed am I by its presence. 

And so, a week ago, I agreed to accompany my love to the haunted house, at her behest. Today, the day of our intended journey, I revealed my trepidation, confessing that I feared I would not find joy in the experience, burdened as I am by my anxiety. Yet still, I offered to go if she so desired. 

My beloved seemed to perceive my confiding in her as a betrayal, lamenting that I should have spoken my truth from the outset, and questioning why I waited until the last moment to express my discomfort. 

With a heartfelt apology, I assured her that if she truly wished to go, I would still accompany her, though it may not be a pleasurable experience for me. She fell silent after this, her focus turning to the sorrow of my perceived failure. 

I then suggested that we should still venture forth and partake in another activity, even if she wished to remain within the safety of our abode. She initially declined my proposal, but eventually conceded, saying, "You plan what we'll do then. I just wanted to do something that we could not do any other time of the year. Where could we even go out to dine that we have not already been?" (These words are not verbatim, but rather a poetic rendering of her sentiment)

I acknowledge that I could have communicated more directly when she first spoke of the haunted houses a few weeks ago. I take responsibility for that. 

My question now is: What do I do now that my beloved is so disheartened, her spirit seemingly weighed down by despair? How can I transform this evening into a moment of joy, or is such a thing no longer possible? 

Any additional guidance, unrelated to my primary queries, is deeply appreciated.  Thank you!

response.28:
Dear Reddit, I made a mistake this morning. I woke up with a nasty cold and decided to take a shower before getting ready for school. I thought to myself, "Why don't I just blow my nose in the shower, as it will all just go down the drain anyway?" Therefore, I proceeded to blow my nose, and large chunks of mucus came flying out of my nose and onto the bottom of the tub. They were so large that I had to intentionally direct the water flow onto them in order to make them move. After getting out of the shower, I felt much better and put on my clothes. As I was downstairs gathering my belongings, I could hear my roommate getting up and walking into the bathroom. I was then greeted by the sound of her screaming, "Oh my goodness!" I quickly went upstairs and saw her standing in the bathroom looking down into the tub. She told me, verbatim, "Shadowheart321, I understand that men have needs, but please can you keep it out of the shower and keep it in your room?" 

I realized when I looked into the tub that we had recently installed a new drain catch and all of my nasal mucus was stuck in it. I quickly explained to her that it was not what she thought and that I was simply very sick and had to blow my nose, and that it was not what she thought. However, she was not listening and was still staring into the tub with an appalled expression on her face. As I attempted to explain what had happened, my other roommate walked into the room to see what the commotion was about. Before I could even try to explain what had occurred, he looked into the tub and started laughing loudly. In a last ditch effort to prove to them that it was not what they thought, I leaned over, stuck my hand into the drain catch and scooped up some of my nasal droppings and asked them to take a deep sniff of it. Then both of them turned out of the bathroom looking queasy as I stood there with a handful of mucus in my palm. Unfortunately, I will now be known as the person who picked up their own nasal mucus from the bottom of the shower and asked them to smell it.

Hey there, last night was my best friend's birthday party and I decided to have some fun in the backyard. I asked one of my friends if he wanted to go check out the "amazing" wooden jungle gym with 4 swings and a big slide. We headed over there and I took a seat on one of the swings while my friend sat on the opposite one, without even swinging! I said to him, "I used to have one just like this when I was a kid," and BAM! The support beam holding up the swings snapped in half and the swing set collapsed. 

Needless to say, I felt awful and my friend was a bit miffed, but he got over it quickly because he's a nice guy like that. After telling his parents this morning, he texted me saying that they weren't at all mad and actually wanted to get rid of it for a while anyways, so I guess I did him a favor. But when his 3 yo brother saw it, he burst out laughing and was extremely amused by the whole situation. I still feel bad about it though, even though his family is OK with it. I think their reactions were worse than mine, not caring about the 3 yo being heartbroken by this, but that may just be my subconscious trying to make me feel better. What do you think, Reddit?
response.32: As someone who is new to Reddit, I understand that default subreddits are subreddits with a certain number of subscribers which makes them visible to people who aren't signed into Reddit or haven't added or removed any subreddits. However, I am finding that some of these default subreddits, such as atheism and politics, can be very off-putting due to the way in which discussions are conducted and the comments from the community. It seems that these subreddits offer a set of narrow principles which can be intimidating for those who do not agree with them, such as religious people or Republicans/conservatives. On the other hand, subreddits that are more neutral and encourage intelligent discussion tend to be much more welcoming to all. Subreddits like videos or funny's are neutral anyway and could be a good 'hook' for new users. I hesitate to recommend Reddit to my friends because they may see some of the incredibly narrow and arrogant opinions expressed in certain default subreddits and associate that with me, which is not something I want. I hope that by understanding my perspective and feelings, this summary can provide a deeper understanding of my intentions.
response.33:
Hello, it seems that you have been in a relationship with your partner for almost 4 years now, and you are feeling like you are just good friends who have sex. It is understandable that you may be feeling this way, as it appears that any type of affection you give him is usually discounted as "needy" or "clingy" and not as "I love you". This can be quite hurtful and make you feel unloved and invalidated. 

One example of this is when you worked together and he was leaving early for a doctor's appointment. You decided to walk out to the parking lot with him, but he kept saying, "It's ok" and "I'm fine you don't have to worry", when all you were doing was just walking him out because you felt like it. This could be seen as him dismissing your feelings and not recognizing the fact that you were simply showing your affection for him.

Another example was when you hadn't really spent much time together in the past few weeks and so when you finally were able to hang out together, you told him that you missed him. He looked at you weird and said, "But I see you all the time....", totally blowing off the fact that this was the first time we actually got to hang out in a while. This could be seen as him not taking into account the fact that this was the first time in a while that you had been able to spend quality time together, which could be seen as him not valuing your feelings or understanding how important it was for you to spend time together.

These are just a few examples of things that have happened recently, but it seems that this is an ongoing issue with your relationship and you feel so unloved because you don't feel like your feelings are being reciprocated by him. You may feel like your feelings are annoying to him and bother him, which can be very difficult to deal with. It is understandable that you do not want to break up, but at the same time, it can be hard to always wonder if he doesn't reciprocate your affection because he doesn't love you. He has mentioned that in previous relationships he was cuddly and affectionate, but his ex girlfriends were cold and distant (according to him). This could be a sign that he may have difficulty expressing his emotions or showing affection, which could be contributing to the issues in your relationship.

Hi, Reddit,

I have come here to ask a few questions and I would like to thank you all in advance for taking the time to read this. I am a police officer and my boyfriend is a bartender. We have been together for about 3 years now and we have had a lot of ups and some downs. When we first met (before I was in law enforcement), we would frequently hang out at bars together. Now, I work night shift and my patrol area is a large group of bars where I basically deal with drunk people constantly throughout the night.

My boyfriend is a bartender in that bar area. Lately, he has been going out and drinking (mostly beer I believe) until about 1am, give or take, in this bar district. He does this while I am at work over night. He does this about 3-4 times a week. 

Sometimes it hurts my feelings because I work so hard in that area to do my job. I am dealing with people who are cussing at me, throwing up on me, working car accidents, dealing with people who are driving while intoxicated, etc. It hurts me to think about my boyfriend hanging out and drinking at these bars while I am working my butt off overnight. If it was occasionally, I wouldn't mind, but it is several nights a week. 

I know that my job is dangerous and I picked my career so I should deal with it. I don't feel like I deserve any special treatment but it also hurts when he decides to stay out and drink instead of coming by the house to say goodbye or anything at all before I go to work. I'm not saying that he should be there every single day, but maybe he could at least shoot me a text or something at least. 

I feel bad for letting it bother me, and I don't want to feel this way. I also don't know who he is with or when he will eventually go home so that adds to it. He knows my feelings on the situation but I feel that he does what he wants sometimes and will just brush it off or just apologize for it later.

I don't want to nag him, he is a grown man, but at the same time, I'm not sure if I could have a potential future with him considering my career. 

Is this normal for guys to do and am I just overreacting?

Alas, fair sir, I didst work at a restaurant as my second occupation, after about a month and a half, things were not proceeding as planned. I shall spare thee the details. However, today, I knew that I was to quit, I was but waiting until the end of my shift.

That's when the other food runner began to act like a millennial. First, she almost engaged in a dispute with me over the length of deployment in the military. I thought it was always four years, apparently to her, it hath always been three. 

Then, whilst I was sitting at the window awaiting for food to come forth, I heard her cry from the other side, "If thou art not doing anything, clean!"

Now, I have worked in restaurants my whole life, I understand the cleaning aspect and I am usually one to clean but I had just wiped down the counter and was conversing with a server while waiting for the ticket to come up.

Who does this wench think she is? 

So finally, I am refilling the ice and a manager cometh up to me and saith, "Is everything well? The food runner hath said that thou art just talking and not working at all, art thou good?"

Oh no she did not.

That's where I snapped. Calmly though. I was on the schedule to close and she was getting out in about fifteen minutes. I went to the office to collect my tips and paychecks for the weeks past. The manager questioned slightly why I was leaving at 1015, I simply said I was leaving at 1030 and was going to clock out right after . Our managers do not check schedules at all.  

I collected my tips and checks and walked out, knowing I had left early enough for them to notice and make her stay until close.

response.49: Ahoy there, matey! He hasn't pulled when on the choke chain at all, even when it was first put on apparently, so we think that's what he was trained on (and damage from that process is probably why his barks and whines sound a bit odd). We now think the scallywags who had 'im before us were violent towards 'im (if ye mime kickin' he runs across the room terrified), so, me question is: he is best behaved on walks when wearin' a choke chain, and it isn't hurtin' 'im at all, but will the harm chokers and the people usin' them caused 'im in the past affect 'im in any way now? I 100% DO NOT want to use a choke chain on 'im and I don't think anyone should ever, ever train a dog that way, but this chain is the only lead we've used that has completely solved the problem with 'im pullin', and he hasn't seemed stressed out by it. If he ever started pullin' on the lead so that the choker was tight, I'd stop usin' it straight away. The last thing I want is me dog bein' hurt. If I'd known these relatives were goin' to put one on 'im, I wouldn't have let 'em look after 'im. Still, it works and doesn't hurt 'im, me only worry is it'll do psychological damage somehow. I have been in a relationship with my boyfriend for over a year, after being friends for a while before we started dating. We have had a number of problems due to his drinking, as well as when I felt under-appreciated after exhausting myself taking care of him when he was having medical problems, and once when some girl kept sending him naked pictures and he did not discourage it. I agreed to this, and he has told me that he wants to marry me and have children, which is something I have never wanted before but with him, I do. 

Recently, however, he has been acting strangely. He said he wanted to move in together, but when I brought up some places I had found, he seemed uncomfortable and weird. He has not talked about the future at all the past month and seems distant. This morning, his phone was making noises and I went to look at it (we do not have issues with phones, he plays with mine all the time). His text menu was open and I saw that he had recently sent a text to his ex from five years ago, with whom he was pseudo-engaged but they broke up after some of her infidelity during long distance. He told her that he "still thought about her every second of every day" and that he missed her so much and begged her to call him. The other day, I was helping my parents move their belongings to their new house, and I decided to bring my laundry over so that I could do it there instead of having to go to the laundromat. The washer and dryer units had already been disconnected from the old house, but my Mom said that she could take my laundry to the rental house and put it in the washer over there. 

However, I had forgotten that I had my Athiest t-shirt in there which I had bought earlier this year to show support for one of my favorite Youtubers. I had been very careful not to let my Mom see it, but unfortunately, today, I made a mistake. 

Sure enough, when I arrived at the rental house, my Mom had already washed and folded all of my clothes, and she was almost in tears when she saw the Athiest t-shirt. At first, I tried to dodge the situation by telling her that "Athiesm is Unstoppable" (which is the phrase printed on the back of the shirt) is just the guy's YouTube username (which it is), and that I do not necessarily associate myself with Athiesm. 

My Mom was shocked and upset by this statement. "Necessarily?!" she shrieked. I realized that I had made a mistake by wording it like that. I then explained to her that I do tend to lean towards "some" Athiest ideas after being exposed to them throughout the years. Unfortunately, this did not do much to calm her down. She begged me to not tell my grandmother about the shirt, and she advised me to get rid of it as soon as possible. "I didn't raise you this way, catjack, and I'm not going to take credit for any of the ideas you've got in your head. Your grandmother would be mortified if she found out," she said.

I am honestly not sure what to do at this point. My Mom is extremely sad and disappointed in me, and I cannot really change my beliefs. I could put on an act and pretend that I am still loyal to God and that I still pray at night, but it wouldn't be nearly as convincing now that she knows about my Athiest t-shirt. I am feeling very conflicted and unsure of how to proceed.
response.92:
I am seeking assistance from the historians and Hungarian members of Reddit. My great grandmother, Marika, was born in 1903 just outside of Budapest, Hungary. In 1921, she immigrated to the United States via Ellis Island. Sometime between 1903 and 1921, she received a number on her arm. My mother has likened it to the numbers received by people at Auschwitz, and she believes that it was approximately six digits in length, and was tattooed on her right forearm. The number was quite large, perhaps four inches in size, and was written in the direction from the elbow to the wrist, as far as my mother remembers. The numbers were written in a sloppy manner, similar to those used during the Holocaust. 

Unfortunately, that is all the information I have. My attempts to gather more information have led me to the conclusion that soldiers in the area may have been given numbers for identification purposes, but my great grandmother was not any type of soldier or involved in the military. She refused to speak of the numbers even when asked directly, and no one had a clue where they came from.

Other details: She worked on a farm her entire life, and was the oldest of eight siblings, four of whom were born before immigrating to the United States, and none of the other siblings had a number. The family was not Jewish - I am aware that there is a history of Jewish oppression in this region, but my family was Christian. 

Can any historians or Hungarian members of Reddit provide me with any further information or insights regarding this matter?

response.140:
The autism link to vaccines is a myth, a falsehood that has been perpetuated by the misguided words of Jenny McCarthy and the falsified evidence that was presented. Yet, despite the overwhelming evidence that vaccines have been an enormous boon to the health of humanity, saving more lives than anything else ever, there is still a need for a more nuanced approach to the issue. In a community that often engages in exploring and exposing the more hidden side of things, it is surprising to see the vociferous down-voting and down-shouting of any opinion that questions the aggressive vaccine schedule recommended by the CDC. 

The truth is, every medication - vaccines included - carries a real set of risks, like a dark cloud hovering over us. Medications are, or should be, given as the least-bad alternative: the risks associated with giving the medicine are outweighed by the rewards of giving the medicine. Each vaccine has its own unique risk/reward profile, and for that reason each warrants individual consideration. The CDC has given this consideration to the vaccines that are on (and not on) the recommended schedule, but that doesn't mean all medical professionals are in agreement regarding the schedule or even the need for all vaccines, nor does it mean that all individuals should refrain from individually investigating each vaccine should they so desire.

There are vested interests in the vaccination schedule, and the CDC is heavily lobbied by the pharmaceutical industry that produces the vaccines we all pay for through our private insurance carriers. This does not necessarily mean that we are having vaccines pushed on us that we don't really need, potentially at risk to our health (however minimal that risk may be), but the incentive is definitely there. Big companies make big money with a more aggressive vaccination schedule, like a storm cloud gathering on the horizon. So why not some actual skeptical discussion instead of blind faith attached to the recommended vaccine schedule? Why not a little more critical thinking and consideration, to bring light to the shadows of this complex issue?

response.157:
Alas, fair Loseit,

A little bit of a soliloquy, for I see so many posts here that are along the lines of I've lost fifty, seventy-five, or even one hundred pounds and have plateaued, or about loose skin, or feeling large even though they've lost large amounts of weight, or frustration with where they are fitness wise, and it makes me think of a running jest my partner and I have. Any time something is taking awhile, or we need to be patient for something we tend to say "give it a moment, it's going to space" in reference to this Louis CK bit 

My opinion is that people need to be more patient when they hit these frustrating points. Bodies are natural systems, and one must respect theirs, for it can only change so much so quickly. The changes some people here are making are so all-encompassing that encountering these problems means they deserve a pat on the back because they represent just how far they have come. Plateau after losing one hundred pounds? It makes me think "oh, thou art frustrated? And art thou virtually unrecognizable from who thou wast last year? Art thou able to enter a gym without feeling awkward? Let alone exercise without feeling like death?". The plateau will break, the loose skin will rebound, and mental perceptions will shift, but thy body might as well be going to space for how much thou art asking it to do. It takes years to get truly unfit; give thyself time to get healthy, internally, externally, and mentally.

response.159:
Alas, fair Reddit. Forgive me for the use of a throwaway account, for my paramour (m27) is the one who hath introduced me to this noble forum, and I am certain he would discover this post if I were to use my true identity. 

My beloved and I have been courting for a year and a half. We met at our place of employment and saw each other on a daily basis. Recently, he hath taken a new position of employment, some two hundred miles away, and thus we doth see each other but once every three weeks.

My quandary is that he WILL NOT speak of the future. Ever. Not at all. Nothing. And it is most difficult to be in this long-distance relationship without any plan of physically being in the same location again or even knowing that such a thing is something we both desire. When we were in each other's presence all the time, the future did not seem to matter as much. But now that he hath departed and we are attempting to remain together, I feel as though I require some assurance as to WHY we are engaging in a long-distance relationship with no foreseeable end. Some reason that it is worth undertaking such a task.

I have endeavored to converse with him regarding this matter. He mentioned that he did not wish to be one of those persons who take the next step in their relationship because they reach a certain age. He also declared that he cannot tell me he knoweth he desireth to be with me because he doth not know, and that he doth not know what shall come to pass in the future. 

I am at a loss as to whether this is a waste of my time and energy. I know that if it were one of my friends seeking counsel from me, I would advise them to let him go and move on if he cannot make up his mind about thee. But for some reason, it is harder to perceive when it is one's own life. I know he loveth me and I know he is indecisive about almost everything else. Perchance he is taking my loyalty for granted? I simply do not know.

So should I stay or should I go? Any insight or advice would be most appreciated.

I have been seeing this guy named Roman for the past 4 months now, and he is really sweet. His nickname is "The Gentle Hulk", which is not a name he wanted but rather one that people have labelled him as. He is a big guy, standing at 6'8 and is really into body building. Today, we were out with one of my friends at a coffee place, and I was talking to Roman about what movie we were going to go see tomorrow. I jokingly suggested an arm wrestle contest, and he put his arm on the table and said "square up". His arm dwarfed mine, it was like a stick compared to a log. My friend then started telling me that if he lets me win at things like that, it will hurt my confidence. She was telling me that it was really rude of him to let me win and that he should not treat me as "weak". response.168: This is a summary of a situation at an airport in Lisbon, Portugal. The author was flying from Fortaleza, Brazil to Stockholm, Sweden with a connection in Lisbon. The flight was delayed, but the TAP staff assured them that they would not miss their transfer flight. However, when they arrived in Lisbon, they were denied boarding due to their luggage not making it to the flight. When asked if they could board anyway and have their luggage sent later, the TAP staff refused. The author then went to the transfer desk, where they found a long line of people from other flights already complaining about their situation. There were only three attendants at the transfer desk, and only one was working. After waiting for over two hours, chaos started and the author began filming when a woman who was in line with them said that they were not allowed to film and that she was allowed to throw their phone away. The author said that they were filming for themselves and not for publication, but the woman said she was from the press and knew the law and that they could not do that. The author put their phone down and told the woman to "fuck off", and eventually managed to get home the next day. The question is whether it is wrong to film inside an airport, and whether the woman was correct in saying that the author was not allowed to do so.

response.171: In the stillness of the night, I found myself on a journey of self-discovery. With trembling hands and a racing heart, I prepared for my first job interview, a chance to prove myself worthy of a competitive position. Despite my nerves, I tried to summon up courage and strength, but all I could do was become a nervous wreck. The interview passed in a blur, and as I returned home, I sought guidance from the stars above. They whispered to me that it was customary to send personalized thank you cards, but alas, I could not remember a single name. I am truly one with the wind, for names slip through my ears like sand through an hourglass. Determined to find the answer, I searched for the company online and found a phone number. With a deep breath, I made the call, hoping to speak to the receptionist and ask for the name of the interviewer. But instead, I heard a voice on the other end - a voice that belonged to none other than Benedict himself. In that moment, time stood still as we spoke, and I felt my cheeks flush with embarrassment as I realized my mistake. "Is that all?" he asked, and with a heavy heart, I bid him farewell, knowing that this was just the beginning of my journey.

response.176: This case study describes a incident that occurred during a previous Christmas holiday. The patient was wearing a pair of slippery Christmas socks, which may have contributed to the subsequent accident. The patient was asked to retrieve some extra plates from the loft, which were stored in a large box. Due to uncertainty about the number of plates required, the patient decided to bring the entire box downstairs. After retrieving the box from the loft, the patient attempted to carry it down the stairs while wearing the slippery socks. Instead of taking the stairs step by step, the patient chose to carry the box in front of their face and walk straight down. This resulted in impaired visibility and a loss of balance, leading to a slip and fall down the stairs. The patient was unable to regain their balance and began running/slipping down the stairs until they reached the bottom, dropping the box and smashing the plates. Additionally, the patient sustained a facial injury, resulting in a broken front tooth. As it was Christmas, medical services were not available, and the patient was unable to receive treatment for their injury until a later date.

response.178:
As a biased and opinionated observer, I can't help but feel sorry for the person posting this. It seems like they are feeling very lonely and isolated due to their lack of experience with dating and kissing. They feel like an outcast because most of their girl friends have had much more experience than them, which is understandable given that they have never done "absolutely nothing" in terms of romantic relationships. 

It appears that the poster is aware that they need to take action and approach guys more often, but they are held back by their fear and insecurity. This is likely due to the fact that they believe that they are "plain average or ugly", which is a very negative and self-deprecating way to view themselves. Unfortunately, this belief may be true, as the poster notes that they never get approached by guys while many of their friends are approached whenever they are out. This must be incredibly difficult for them to accept, as it reinforces their belief that they are not attractive enough to be noticed by potential partners.

The poster goes on to say that they know that they need to "suck up and realize the genetics didn't work in [their] favor", which is a very harsh and unfair way to look at the situation. While it may be true that they are not as physically attractive as some of their friends, this does not mean that they are unworthy of love and affection. It is clear that the poster is struggling to come to terms with their appearance and the fact that they have not had any romantic experiences yet, which is a difficult thing to accept. However, it is important for them to remember that everyone has different experiences and that there is no "normal" when it comes to relationships.

response.185:
It can be very discouraging to be trying to lose weight and see the scale go up. Sometimes the scale may go up several days in a row, and it can be frustrating to wake up in the morning, feeling sleepy and naked, standing on the scale and thinking, "What is going on?" However, it is important to remember that this is just a temporary rise and that it is possible to keep trying. To help motivate yourself, you can try to shake off the negative feelings and start the water running for a shower, telling yourself, 'It's okay, it's just a temporary rise, I will keep trying.' Then, you can go on about your day, like the weight loss hero that you are. 

To track your weight loss progress over the last 4 months, you can create a graph in a spreadsheet program. The graph may not be a straight line down, but rather it may have peaks and valleys. The general trend may be down, which is a positive sign (28lbs today - congratulations!). However, you may have noticed that every time you experience a significant amount of weight loss, known as the "whoosh fairy", it may take back some of the weight over the next week. But then, it may give you just a bit more weight loss - enough to keep the graph going down. This is a sign that your efforts are paying off, and it is important to keep trying, even when the scale goes up despite your best efforts (and even when it goes up after your worst efforts). Thank you, Whoosh Fairy, for your help and support. I love you.

response.189:
Alas, fair maiden, I am a senior in the study of biochemistry, and I doth enjoy the music of old - a huge admirer of the Dead. And verily, I do love to write. However, my family is nothing like me. They are narrow-minded, voting only for the Republican party, none of them have ever gone to college, and they all love the modern pop country music; not that I mind, but I think that says much about a person.

Now, I could bear with these differences if they stopped there. The deeper issues are rooted in their ignorance of my true nature and their stubbornness towards simply trying to understand. In my youth, I was diagnosed with Major Depression Disorder with psychotic features, and then later on with Bipolar 1. On many days, all I can do is lie in the darkness and list reasons to continue living.

This frequent inability to do anything is viewed as laziness by my family, and the way they berate me makes it so much worse. Yet, I have a 3.8 GPA and have been accepted into a few PhD programs for neurobiology. I have had steady jobs with good pay, but they refuse to believe that I can make it on my own.

I have stayed with friends on many occasions, and the depression seems to subside, or at least lessen immensely, almost the instant I am out of the disapproving gaze of my parents. During these times, I feel like a completely different person, like being drunk without drinking, thought patterns change and even the air is lighter. Yet, when I come back home still stimulated with the residual joy of temporary freedom, there must be something wrong with me, and they interrogate the individuality out of me.

Oh, how I wish to leave and try to live a happy life, but I feel like a human whom Pavlov experimented upon. How do I get out of this mindset and become the person I want to be?
response.190: Alas, fair reader, I hath sold my carriage to a gentleman named Bob, some months ago. I didst sign over the title to Bob and made him sign a bill of sale/notice of transfer. I didst receive three copies, one of which I didst mail unto the tax collector's office on the morrow. I heard naught from either the Bob or the tax collector for nearly two moons. Then today, a friend of a Bob came by and spake that Bob hath sold it unto another, Jim. Bob never transferred the title over to himself when he purchased the carriage. Instead, he didst sell it unto Jim. Jim attempted to go get tags in his name, but cannot, for the title is still under mine own name. Bob and friend gave Jim my number and said that they are not going to deal with the situation and Bob hath changed his number.Now Jim doth desire me to go with him to the DMV and sign the title over to him. That is not legal, I think, for I didst sell the carriage unto Bob, and I already turned in the bill of sale/notice of transfer to the tax collector. So is this not out of my control and Bob's problem? I pray thee, what do I do about this, if anything at all? I doth reside in Florida, if that be relevant.

Arrr, me hearties! I be skeptical o' this tale o' a young, scurvy salesman kid tryin' to swindle other car owners into buyin' his car cleanin' spray put out by a famous racin' league. Me thinks this pirate has a bit o' a flashy car, so it was only a matter o' time before he came to me as I had a lot o' gas to fill. When he came up to me, he started with the usual sleaze about how we must be cousins because we both drive BMWs. Me doubts he has any real skills, and I'm surprised he's ever sold anything in his life if his current behavior was any indication as to how he approaches people.

He proceeded to test it on me car, and, aye, it did seem to work but I just wasn't interested. Well, not until he said, "Okay, ye know what bro? I'm just gonna give ye one. A can for free, on the house." Surprised, I walked over to the table where his setup was and also where a female coworker o' his was standin', and he then handed me a can and said, "Okay, so it's only $10." Again, I was surprised, and instead o' disputin' his offer, I went ahead and pulled out me credit card and paid for it. Oh, and there was a $2 tax on the damn thing so it actually came out to $12.

He ran me card, handed me a receipt, and the transaction was over. I'm sure he felt good about havin' basically hustled me into walkin' over there under the impression that I'd get a free can and then actually makin' a sale. I handed him the can back and said, "I want ye to give this to the next person ye promise a free can to. Now ye can actually keep yer word," and got back in me car and drove off.

It felt good doin' this, but me doubts this pirate's story is true. I'd love to hear some tales o' similar things that ye may have done to help others at yer cost, perhaps to prove a point or just to flat out pay it forward, but I'm skeptical o' any claims made without evidence.

Hello, I am writing to ask for advice on behalf of my father, who is 60 years old. He has worked as a floor layer for his entire life, but unfortunately, he hasn't been able to work much in the past 5 years as his body has basically given out on him. Right now, he is living in Toronto on welfare, but he really wants to work. However, he is facing some challenges in finding employment. 

First of all, he is 60 years old, which can make it difficult for him to find a job. Additionally, he has a criminal record for assault - he hit a guy's truck with a shovel while the guy was in it. He is currently in the process of pardoning his record, but apparently it takes 3 years to do so. He also does not have a driver's license, which can limit his job opportunities. Furthermore, he does not have any decent job references, as he has spent his whole life contracting and has unfortunately burnt way too many bridges. He also has family in Toronto, but he does not get along with very few of them. 

Another challenge that my father is facing is that he is quick to anger. While he was a great dad, he never got along well with others who pissed him off, which leads us into the fact that he has hung out with a lot of shitty people through his life, the type who screw you over when they get the chance. As a result, he has very few friends. 

Basically, I don't know what to suggest for him. Where can he get work? He can't lay floors anymore, as he is too old to function. He can't do anything customer facing, due to his assault record. He also doesn't have any office skills.

Please Reddit, I will take any suggestions anyone has.

One last point, my father is needing to get both knees replaced this year at some point. So aside from being down for about 12 weeks, he probably can't do a job where he has to stand the entire day.

response.205:
Oh, the mighty [tree that fell in my yard], a symbol of nature's wrath and a reminder of the fragility of life. The winds of August swept it away, leaving behind a trail of destruction and despair. But alas, the homeowner's insurance offered but a mere whisper of hope - a meager $150 to help me remove the fallen giant, a drop in the ocean of my sorrow. 

Yet, I am to blame for this tragedy, for I had put the lowest possible amount of insurance on the place, a foolish attempt to satisfy the demands of the park. 

For months now, I have been trying to sell this place cheap, with the tree still looming in the yard, but to no avail. Just to cleanse my hands of the mess that I cannot afford to get rid of.

Today, a "final notice" arrived in the mail, a haunting reminder that the tree must be removed by December 12th or else I shall be in violation of some community policy, and they shall bill me to have them remove the tree, and my "positive relationship with the management office" shall be no more.

I must find a way to make or borrow about $2,000 for the complete cleanup, a sum that I shall repay when I sell the house, which should be soon (my house is priced at about 60% of its actual value, a reflection of the tree's presence and my desire to leave this place as soon as possible).

I am but a young soul, with minimal credit, lost in the darkness of uncertainty. Why do I turn to Reddit for advice? Perhaps it is my form of panicking, a desperate cry for help in this tumultuous storm.

Alas, I was cast out from my seasonal part-time employment upon a haunted hayride, with nary an explanation save that I did not 'fit in' to the 'family'. I didst journey the mile from mine own abode to the farm to retrieve my paycheck, only to discover that it was shorted a day. I immediately brought this matter unto the attention of the owners' wives, who promised to remedy the situation. 

Lo! It came to pass that on the very same night I was there, perchance the exact moment, someone was stalking the wagons in the woods, and fired a BB gun at a customer, wounding her. Mine own phone was dead and mine own television had been stolen, thus I had no knowledge of what had occurred when I returned to follow-up on my pay the following weekend. The woman at the desk didst identify me, calling forth the boss, who called the detectives, who came and interrogated me. 

Normally, I doth recognize that it is a most terrible idea to speak with the constables, for fear of self-incrimination and all, but I was caught completely off-guard and had no idea what was transpiring until I eventually caught on to what had happened and they filled me in. Regardless, though I may feel undervalued by with the employer, I am not a psychotic criminal. 

I fear that I have spoken too much (which is true past hello) and that if they do not catch the perpetrator then they will come after me. I agreed to a polygraph, and spake with my lawyer, who told me not to do it because it oft comes out inconclusive. I didst cut off contact with the detectives whom hopefully recognize that I am honest and harmless. Nonetheless, mine own family hath been freaking out at the thought of being raided and/or searched based upon circumstantial evidence.
